title: Bailey
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The Bailey is the still-occupied and well-guarded fortress of an orcish lord. The treasures within are protected by both physical barriers and large numbers of well armed humanoid warriors. |

[![Bailey portal.png](/images/9/9c/Bailey_portal.png)](/File:Bailey_portal.png) **Bailey** is temporary [portal](/Portal "Portal") level with a medieval warfare theme. Many baileys are built around a castle theme, and some may exploit [water](/Water "Water") to shoot [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") at you.

Baileys may appear on Dungeon: 7-10. The portal is signaled by the "creaking of a portcullis".

## Contents

- [1 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [2 Treasure](#Treasure)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Monsters

Baileys are most often filled with roaming bands of the following monsters:

|                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                             |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| K [![Kobold.png](/images/d/d2/Kobold.png)](/File:Kobold.png) **[Kobold](/Kobold_\(monster\) "Kobold (monster)")** | g [![Goblin.png](/images/d/d2/Goblin.png)](/File:Goblin.png) **[Goblin](/Goblin "Goblin")**                               | g [![Hobgoblin.png](/images/3/31/Hobgoblin.png)](/File:Hobgoblin.png) **[Hobgoblin](/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin")**       | g [![Gnoll.png](/images/8/8e/Gnoll.png)](/File:Gnoll.png) **[Gnoll](/Gnoll_\(monster\) "Gnoll (monster)")** |
| o [![Orc.png](/images/b/bf/Orc.png)](/File:Orc.png) **[Orc](/Orc "Orc")**                                         | o [![Orc warrior.png](/images/2/25/Orc_warrior.png)](/File:Orc_warrior.png) **[Orc warrior](/Orc_warrior "Orc warrior")** | o [![Orc knight.png](/images/1/16/Orc_knight.png)](/File:Orc_knight.png) **[Orc knight](/Orc_knight "Orc knight")** |                                                                                                             |

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts, or as the "boss" defending the loot at the end:

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| g [![Gnoll sergeant.png](/images/a/a1/Gnoll_sergeant.png)](/File:Gnoll_sergeant.png) **[Gnoll sergeant](/Gnoll_sergeant "Gnoll sergeant")** \| g [![Gnoll bouda.png](/images/d/d3/Gnoll_bouda.png)](/File:Gnoll_bouda.png) **[Gnoll shaman](/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman")** |

- If you see lots of gnolls and polearms, expect to see some of these guys as well.

|                                                                                                                                                             |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| c [![Centaur (monster).png](/images/8/87/Centaur_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Centaur_\(monster\).png) **[Centaur](/Centaur_\(monster\) "Centaur (monster)")** |

- If you see lots of open water, you are about to get attacked by centaurs... with javelins!

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| o [![Orc sorcerer.png](/images/c/c6/Orc_sorcerer.png)](/File:Orc_sorcerer.png) **[Orc sorcerer](/Orc_sorcerer "Orc sorcerer")** \| o [![Orc high priest.png](/images/b/b1/Orc_high_priest.png)](/File:Orc_high_priest.png) **[Orc high priest](/Orc_high_priest "Orc high priest")** \| K [![Kobold demonologist.png](/images/f/f5/Kobold_demonologist.png)](/File:Kobold_demonologist.png) **[Kobold demonologist](/Kobold_demonologist "Kobold demonologist")** |

- If you start seeing these guys, you better have high magic resistance and a way to dispatch them quickly before they call in a bunch of demons.

|                                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| o [![Orc warlord.png](/images/7/76/Orc_warlord.png)](/File:Orc_warlord.png) **[Orc warlord](/Orc_warlord "Orc warlord")** |

- Found at the end of several baileys, these guys are a serious threat to any character. Try to fight them only after you've cleared the bailey of other monsters.

## Treasure

- Baileys generally have useful loot, especially for those wielding axes or polearms. Items usually consist of good weapons and armour, as well as rare [potions](/Potion "Potion") and [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll").

## Tips & Tricks

- Players should exercise caution when entering a bailey. It is entirely possible to become overwhelmed by the enemies inside and end up using precious consumables to escape without gaining access to any of the treasure.
- If you have a wand of polymorph, you can put it to good use here. Orc warriors may be good with arbalests, but wyverns certainly are not.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), baileys could appear from D:7-14 and Orc:1. Also, many layouts were adjusted in this version.

|            | Temporary [Portals](/Portals "Portals")                                                                                                                                                            |
| ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Early Game | [Ossuary](/Ossuary "Ossuary") • [Sewers](/Sewers "Sewers")                                                                                                                                         |
| Mid Game   | [Bailey]() • [Gauntlet](/Gauntlet "Gauntlet") • [Ice cave](/Ice_cave "Ice cave") • [Volcano](/Volcano "Volcano")                                                                                   |
| Late Game  | [Desolation of Salt](/Desolation_of_Salt "Desolation of Salt") • [Wizard Laboratory](/Wizard_Laboratory "Wizard Laboratory") • [Ziggurat](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat") ([Mega-Zig](/Mega-Zig "Mega-Zig")) |
| Peaceful   | [Bazaar](/Bazaar "Bazaar") • [Treasure trove](/Treasure_trove "Treasure trove")                                                                                                                    |
html:
Bailey

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
The Bailey is the still-occupied and well-guarded fortress of an orcish lord. The treasures within are protected by both physical barriers and large numbers of well armed humanoid warriors.

Bailey is temporary portal level with a medieval warfare theme. Many baileys are built around a castle theme, and some may exploit water to shoot Ranged Weapons at you.

Baileys may appear on Dungeon: 7-10. The portal is signaled by the "creaking of a portcullis".

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Treasure
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Monsters

Baileys are most often filled with roaming bands of the following monsters:

K Kobold g Goblin g Hobgoblin g Gnoll
o Orc o Orc warrior o Orc knight

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts, or as the "boss" defending the loot at the end:

g Gnoll sergeant | g Gnoll shaman
  • If you see lots of gnolls and polearms, expect to see some of these guys as well.
c Centaur
  • If you see lots of open water, you are about to get attacked by centaurs... with javelins!
o Orc sorcerer | o Orc high priest | K Kobold demonologist
  • If you start seeing these guys, you better have high magic resistance and a way to dispatch them quickly before they call in a bunch of demons.
o Orc warlord
  • Found at the end of several baileys, these guys are a serious threat to any character. Try to fight them only after you've cleared the bailey of other monsters.

Treasure

  • Baileys generally have useful loot, especially for those wielding axes or polearms. Items usually consist of good weapons and armour, as well as rare potions and scrolls.

Tips & Tricks

  • Players should exercise caution when entering a bailey. It is entirely possible to become overwhelmed by the enemies inside and end up using precious consumables to escape without gaining access to any of the treasure.
  • If you have a wand of polymorph, you can put it to good use here. Orc warriors may be good with arbalests, but wyverns certainly are not.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, baileys could appear from D:7-14 and Orc:1. Also, many layouts were adjusted in this version.
Temporary Portals
Early Game Ossuary • Sewers
Mid Game Bailey • Gauntlet • Ice cave • Volcano
Late Game Desolation of Salt • Wizard Laboratory • Ziggurat (Mega-Zig)
Peaceful Bazaar • Treasure trove
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Bailey&oldid=74228"

{{version030}}
{{flavour|The Bailey is the still-occupied and well-guarded fortress of an orcish lord. The treasures within are protected by both physical barriers and large numbers of well armed humanoid warriors.
}}
[[File:Bailey portal.png]] '''Bailey''' is temporary [[portal]] level with a medieval warfare theme. Many baileys are built around a castle theme, and some may exploit [[water]] to shoot [[Ranged Weapons]] at you.

Baileys may appear on Dungeon: 7-10. The portal is signaled by the "creaking of a portcullis".

==Monsters==
Baileys are most often filled with roaming bands of the following monsters:

{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{Brown|K}} [[File:Kobold_(monster).png]] '''[[Kobold (monster)|Kobold]]''' || {{monsterlink|Goblin}} || {{monsterlink|Hobgoblin}} || {{Yellow|g}} [[File:Gnoll (monster).png]] '''[[Gnoll (monster)|Gnoll]]'''
|-
| {{LightRed|o}} [[File:Orc.png]] '''[[Orc]]''' || {{Yellow|o}} [[File:Orc_warrior.png]] '''[[Orc warrior]]''' || {{Cyan|o}} [[File:Orc_knight.png]] '''[[Orc knight]]''' 
|}

Other monsters only appear in specific layouts, or as the "boss" defending the loot at the end:

{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{monsterlink|Gnoll sergeant}} | {{monsterlink|Gnoll shaman}}
|}
*If you see lots of gnolls and polearms, expect to see some of these guys as well. 

{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{Brown|c}} [[File:Centaur_(monster).png]] '''[[Centaur (monster)|Centaur]]'''
|}
*If you see lots of open water, you are about to get attacked by centaurs... with javelins!

{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{monsterlink|Orc sorcerer}} | {{monsterlink|Orc high priest}} | {{monsterlink|Kobold demonologist}}
|}
*If you start seeing these guys, you better have high magic resistance and a way to dispatch them quickly before they call in a bunch of demons.

{| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:0; padding:0;"
|-
| {{monsterlink|Orc warlord}}
|}
*Found at the end of several baileys, these guys are a serious threat to any character. Try to fight them only after you've cleared the bailey of other monsters.

==Treasure==
*Baileys generally have useful loot, especially for those wielding axes or polearms. Items usually consist of good weapons and armour, as well as rare [[potion]]s and [[scroll]]s.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Players should exercise caution when entering a bailey. It is entirely possible to become overwhelmed by the enemies inside and end up using precious consumables to escape without gaining access to any of the treasure.
*If you have a wand of polymorph, you can put it to good use here. Orc warriors may be good with arbalests, but wyverns certainly are not.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.28]], baileys could appear from D:7-14 and Orc:1. Also, many layouts were adjusted in this version.
